verb.description: Separate (a substance) into soluble and insoluble constituents by the percolation of liquid.
examples: the dyestuff was extracted by lixiviating freshly cut wood with water

origin: Mid 17th century: from modern Latin lixiviat- impregnated with lye, from the verb lixiviare, from lixivius made into lye, from lix lye.
